definition: editorial (in a newspaper)/CL:篇[pian1]
society/group/club/agency/(old) god of the land
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: We now bring you the full text of the Renmin Ribao editorial.
sentences.chinese: 現在全文廣播《人民日報》社論。

sentences.english: The newspaper has since apologised for this editorial.
sentences.chinese: 報紙已就這個社論做出了道歉。

sentences.english: The editorial invests heavily in a family planning policy.
sentences.chinese: 該社論用很大篇幅闡述計劃生育政策。

sentences.english: The editorial was a trail balloon to test the public's reaction to a change in the school day.
sentences.chinese: 這篇社論是要試探出公衆對於變更校歷的反應。

sentences.english: Recently a Bangkok Post editorial accused China of “Killing the Mekong”.
sentences.chinese: 最近《曼谷郵報》一篇社論譴責中國“謀殺湄公河”。

sentences.english: He recomposed the editorial till dawn.
GREENWIRE also provides link to environmental opinion-editorials.
sentences.chinese: GREENWIRE也提供環境社論的連結。

sentences.english: Here is a passage quoted from the editorial.
sentences.chinese: 這是引自社論的一篇文章。

sentences.english: The newspaper editorial defamed the politician.
sentences.chinese: 該報社論誣衊這名政治家。

sentences.english: She has read the editorial through twice.
sentences.chinese: 她把社論已經校對了兩遍了。

sentences.english: I read the editorials every day.
The editorial one is a relatively minor.
sentences.chinese: 社論是相對較小的問題。

sentences.english: Justin Raimondo author and editorial director of Antiwar. com.
sentences.chinese: 賈斯廷萊曼多，作者，反戰網站的社論編輯。

sentences.english: The old paradigm of maintaining a wall between advertising and editorial still has a lot of validity, though.
sentences.chinese: 但是廣告和社論之間的傳統界限依然不能廢除。

sentences.english: The editorial needs to be rewritten.
Le Monde needs to act decisively to preserve its brand and editorial influence.
sentences.chinese: 《世界報》需要果斷地保留它的品牌和社論的影響力。

press conference
China Times (newspaper)

Ming Pao newspaper (Hong Kong)
chaotic situation
Secretary for Security (Hong Kong)
to answer a question/question and answer
Xi Jinping (1953-), PRC politician, General Secretary of the CCP from 2012, president of the PRC from 2013
abbr. for 信報財經新聞|信报财经新闻, Hong Kong Economic Journal
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
